page.title: 11THE SEVERN STOKE LANDSCAPE
page.content: The villages of Severn Stoke and Kinnersley are sited in a gently undulating{agricultural landscape}of crop land and cultivated grass. The tree cover is sporadic, concentrated for the most part in Cliffey Wood and Croome Park. The River Severn winds its way through the south_west corner of the area. The local{architecture}is a mixture of styles and ages, from the many black and white Elizabethan timbered farm houses to the modern rectangular brick buildings of the new housing estates and bungalows. The church of St. Denys is typical of the Saxon period. Two notable buildings are the old sadle house on the A38 south of Severn Stoke and the Panorama on Knights hill, both built by the Earl of Coventry in the last century.
